How can I use the Verus command line to retrieve a specific block by its hash?

You can use the `getblock` command followed by the block hash to retrieve a specific block. For example:

```
verus getblock "00000000febc373a1da2bd9f887b105ad79ddc26ac26c2b28652d64e5207c5b5"
```

Examples: > verus getblock "00000000febc373a1da2bd9f887b105ad79ddc26ac26c2b28652d64e5207c5b5" > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblock", "params": ["00000000febc373a1da2bd9f887b105ad79ddc26ac26c2b28652d64e5207c5b5"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/ > verus getblock 12800 > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getblock", "params": [12800] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
